answers.answer: As far as coumadin v asprin, that is a decision btwn you and your doc.  I have been on coumadin for 3.5 yrs and will be on it for the rest of my life.  I don't like it but I have come to terms with it.I have AFib.  I have had 4 ablations (3 for AFib and 1 AVJ and pacer implanted) I have traveled several times out of the country and worked with my EP for solutions to AFib episodes when overseas.  The algorithm was to take extra meds, or "a pill in the pocket" approach.  I also have a 24 hr number to call EP lab at the med center and a doc is always available.  While out of the country, I did have a long run of AFib and I took the "pill in the pocket" and called the med center.  Having that number at my disposal was very comforting to me when I was so far away from home.Good luck to you.
